subclusters.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
Protein Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline of proteostasis via impaired autophagy-lysosome and ubiquitin-proteasome systems leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ER quality control adaptation and unfolded protein response as part of proteostasis decline in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cellular proteostasis collapse and failure of protein homeostasis as a conserved aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights chaperone overload, impaired folding capacity, and proteostasis decline as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ubiquitin-proteasome system dysfunction, especially UBB+1 mutant effects, impairing proteostasis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis dysregulation in brain aging via UPS and autophagy impairment leading to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ubiquitin ligases and UPS dysregulation contributing to proteostasis loss and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes broad proteostasis decline including synthesis, folding, and degradation impairments driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteasome activation and its decline as a key driver of proteostasis loss and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights chaperone-protein degradation network efficiency as determinant of longevity and proteostasis maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chaperone-mediated proteome maintenance and proteolytic system impairment in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteasome impairment and oxidative stress as causes of proteostasis failure in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links proteostasis network decline to genome instability, emphasizing proteome stability as key for DNA integrity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models chaperone capacity decline and protein aggregation as central to senescence and proteostasis loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis network collapse driving aging and cancer via proteome instability and genomic stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed decline of proteostasis network and cell-nonautonomous regulation of proteostasis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links proteasome dysfunction to proteome instability, mitochondrial dysfunction, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes integrated protein quality control system decline causing proteotoxic stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative protein damage and proteasome dysfunction as central to proteostasis failure in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Quality Control Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes selective regulation of protein synthesis and degradation via mTOR inhibition affecting proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of damaged proteins from ROS/RNS and metabolic adaptations driving replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes spontaneous chemical protein damage and enzymatic repair mechanisms balancing aging-related damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreversible oxidative protein carbonylation as primary cause of aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of diverse protein damages and benefits of young undamaged proteins in aging mitigation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transcription Error-Induced Amyloidogenesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on transcription errors generating mutant amyloid-like proteins that seed aggregation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteome Stabilization and Reduced Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes longevity via proteome stabilization by trehalose and reduced protein turnover in daf-2 mutants.
